title: Trinidad and Tobago national rugby union team
text:
The Trinidad and Tobago national rugby union team has thus far not qualified for the <a href="Rugby%20World%20Cup">Rugby World Cup</a>, but has participated in <a href="Rugby%20World%20Cup%20qualification">qualifying tournaments</a> since 1999. They are classed as a tier-three nation by <a href="World%20Rugby">World Rugby</a>.
The national side is ranked 52nd in the world (as of 29 July 2019).
History.
Trinidad and Tobago played their first ever rugby international in 1979 in Georgetown against <a href="Bermuda%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Bermuda</a>. Trinidad and Tobago lost the contest 8 points to 42. Trinidad and Tobago attempted to qualify for the <a href="1999%20Rugby%20World%20Cup">1999 Rugby World Cup</a> in <a href="Wales">Wales</a>. Their first match of the <a href="1999%20Rugby%20World%20Cup%20qualifying%23Round%201%202">Americas qualifying tournament</a> was a one-off Round 1 match against <a href="Brazil%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Brazil</a> in Port of Spain. Trinidad and Tobago won the game 41 points to nil and advanced to Round 2, where they faced <a href="Chile%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Chile</a> and Bermuda in a pool series. Trinidad and Tobago lost their first match 6-35 against Chile, and lost their second against Bermuda 52-6, and were knocked out of the qualifying tournaments.
The team were involved in qualifying tournaments for the <a href="2003%20Rugby%20World%20Cup">2003 Rugby World Cup</a> in Australia as well, participating in the <a href="2003%20Rugby%20World%20Cup%20-%20Americas%20qualification">Round 1 Americas tournament</a>. The team defeated <a href="Jamaica%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Jamaica</a> 51-5 in their first match, and went on to win 12-8 over the <a href="Cayman%20Islands%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Cayman Islands</a> in their second game. Trinidad and Tobago then won their third match 23-12 over Bermuda to advance to Round 2. There the team was narrowly defeated 10-11 by Brazil, and then nil to 9 in the second match, and Trinidad and Tobago were knocked out of the tournament.
In 2005 Trinidad and Tobago participated in <a href="2007%20Rugby%20World%20Cup%20-%20Americas%20qualification">qualifying tournaments</a> for the <a href="2007%20Rugby%20World%20Cup">2007 Rugby World Cup</a> in France. They were grouped in the South of the pool of Round 1a along with <a href="Barbados%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Barbados</a>, <a href="Guyana%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Guyana</a> and <a href="Saint%20Lucia%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Saint Lucia</a>. Trinidad and Tobago won their first match 82-8 over Saint Lucia, though they lost to Barbados and Guyana, finishing third in the pool which ended their qualifying campaign.
Trinidad and Tobago compete in the <a href="Caribbean%20Championship">Caribbean Championship</a>, a tournament which includes <a href="Antigua%20and%20Barbuda%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Antigua</a>, <a href="Bermuda%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Bermuda</a>, the <a href="Cayman%20Islands%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Cayman Islands</a>, <a href="Jamaica%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Jamaica</a>, the <a href="Bahamas%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Bahamas</a>, <a href="British%20Virgin%20Islands%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">British Virgin Islands</a>, and <a href="Guyana%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Guyana</a>.
Trinidad and Tobago win in the Caribbean Cup made them advance to the next round of the <a href="2011%20Rugby%20World%20Cup">2011 Rugby World Cup</a> qualification, where they had to face <a href="Brazil%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Brazil</a>. The "Calypso Warriors" faced the notorious improvement of their South Americans counterparts and they lost both games, 31-8 at home and 24-12 away, ending their hopes to qualify again.
In <a href="2015%20NACRA%20Rugby%20Championship">2015</a>, Trinidad and Tobago won the <a href="NACRA%20Rugby%20Championship">NACRA Rugby Championship</a>, defeating Mexico 30-16 in the final.
Current squad.
Squad to 2012 <a href="North%20America%20Caribbean%20Rugby%20Association">NACRA</a> Championship 23 June 2012
